TITLE: Here's how to pay 0% capital gains taxes with a six-figure income
SUMMARY: You may qualify for the 0% long-term capital gains rate with a six-figure income. Here's how to calculate your taxable income to harvest tax-free gains.

TITLE: There's new optimism the $300 monthly child tax credit checks can be renewed — but the relief may look different
SUMMARY: There's new hope the monthly child tax credit payments of up to $300 per month can be renewed. Here's how those checks may be different.

TITLE: Long-term unemployment dips by another 70,000 people. Here's what that means for job seekers
SUMMARY: The ranks of people who are unemployed for at least six months continue to decline in a strong labor market for job seekers.

TITLE: Biden's student loan forgiveness application will go live any day now. Here's how to prepare
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education has said the application for student loan forgiveness will be live in early October, suggesting it could be ready any day now.

TITLE: These are the 10 states where renters are most behind on payments — and high-cost California didn't make the list
SUMMARY: Some 15% of American households, around 6 million, are behind on rent this fall, according to a new report. Here's where renters are struggling the most.

TITLE: As California stimulus checks of up to $1,050 start to go out, here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: As many as 23 million Californians will benefit from a record-high state surplus when they receive direct payments starting this month.

TITLE: 'The month of unprecedented deals' — From Amazon to Target, here's what you need to know about the early holiday sales going on now
SUMMARY: Retailers are kicking off a slew of holiday deals earlier than ever before. Here's a rundown of some of the sales events happening now.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot is $410 million. Here are 3 key things to do if you win
SUMMARY: Given the size of the windfall, there are a few important things to do if you discover you're holding the winning ticket, experts say.

TITLE: 'Billions of dollars get left behind': The 401(k) industry now has a 'lost and found' for your old retirement accounts
SUMMARY: Three of the biggest 401(k) administrators have teamed up to automatically reconnect workers with savings left behind at an old employer.

TITLE: As more consumers go cashless, here's why you may still want to have some money handy
SUMMARY: Fewer Americans are paying for routine weekly purchases like food or gas in cash. But that doesn't mean you should give up going to the ATM altogether.

TITLE: More car buyers pay at least $1,000 a month for their loans as high prices, rate hikes throw 'a one-two punch'
SUMMARY: Overall, 14.3% of consumers who financed a new car in the third quarter committed to payments above $1,000 per month, up from 8.3% during year-earlier period.

TITLE: Despite inflation worries, Americans are less likely to cancel Amazon Prime, Netflix than cut spending on food
SUMMARY: Despite inflation concerns, Americans are less likely to cancel streaming services than cut spending on food and clothing, a recent report found.

TITLE: FA 100: How to invest heading into a recession, according to top-ranked advisors
SUMMARY: Despite the economic uncertainty, there is still plenty of upside potential for investors, experts say. Here's their advice for making the most of it.

TITLE: Op-ed: 'Is college even worth it?' It's certainly not the only path to a successful career
SUMMARY: Student debt forgiveness is only a Band-Aid. As tuition rises and wages don't seem to match, many Americans need to ask the question: "Is college even worth it?"

TITLE: Key Democrat outlines 5 priorities for $80 billion in IRS funding
SUMMARY: Senate Finance Committee Chairman Ron Wyden, D-Ore., has outlined five priorities for nearly $80 billion in new IRS funding. Here's a breakdown of each one.

TITLE: 46% of Americans continue to make this expensive credit card mistake
SUMMARY: One of the biggest credit card misconceptions is that carrying a balance month to month will give your credit score a boost.

SUMMARY: If you're racing to meet the Oct. 17 tax extension deadline, don't skip these easy-to-miss forms. Here are three common mistakes, according to the experts.

TITLE: 'Universities are going to continue to suffer.' Some colleges struggle with enrollment declines, underfunding
SUMMARY: Enrollment declines and underfunding have hit the higher education system hard. A number of colleges are in financial jeopardy.

TITLE: High inflation has many Americans tweaking their holiday travel plans
SUMMARY: Higher travel prices are eating into Americans' budgets for trips between Thanksgiving and New Year's, according to a Bankrate survey.

TITLE: Biden's student loan forgiveness plan could cost $379 billion over 30 years, Education Department estimates
SUMMARY: President Biden's one-time student loan forgiveness will cost $30 billion per year over the next decade, according to the Education Department.

TITLE: Here's why protecting Social Security may be a consensus issue for key group of women voters in the midterm elections
SUMMARY: Women ages 50 and up are a key group to watch in November's election. While they have diverse views, protecting Social Security may be one issue they agree on.

TITLE: TreasuryDirect sold more than $27 billion in Series I bonds since Nov. 1. Now it’s getting a makeover
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has unveiled a makeover for TreasuryDirect, the platform used to buy Series I bonds. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: FA 100: CNBC ranks the top-rated financial advisory firms of 2022
SUMMARY: For the fourth year, CNBC unveils its ranking of top financial advisors. The CNBC FA 100 recognizes firms that best help clients navigate their financial lives.

TITLE: The CNBC FA 100 ranking recognizes advisory firms that help clients navigate their financial lives
SUMMARY: The CNBC FA 100 recognizes advisory firms that help clients navigate their financial lives. This annual ranking may help you find an advisor to work with.

TITLE: When investing in a company, CNBC's No. 1 financial advisor agrees with Warren Buffett: 'He likes cash flow'
SUMMARY: Woodley Farra, which has $1.4 billion under management and 1,000 clients, came in at No. 1 on CNBC's ranking of the top 100 financial advisory firms in the U.S.

TITLE: CNBC's No. 1 financial advisor shares his top 3 stock picks
SUMMARY: The co-founder of Woodley Farra Manion, ranked No. 1 on CNBC's FA 100 list for 2022, shares his advice for navigating market volatility.

TITLE: Here's how we determine the FA 100 ranking for 2022
SUMMARY: The methodology for the 2022 CNBC FA 100 ranking of registered investment advisors was prepared in partnership with data provider AccuPoint Solutions.

TITLE: The job market's ‘game of musical chairs’ may be slowing — but workers still have power, say economists
SUMMARY: Job openings had a near-record monthly decline in August, signaling a slowdown in employer demand. But workers still have bargaining power, economists said.

TITLE: With S&P 500 down 20% this year, retirement investors flee to safety and reconsider stock, bond strategy
SUMMARY: During market drops in September, some investors took money out of stocks and shifted it to more conservative investments.

TITLE: This is the best time to apply for college financial aid — here's why you should file the FAFSA now
SUMMARY: Although the FAFSA for the 2023-24 academic year isn't due until June 30, 2024, it's wise to apply as soon as you can.
